summary: This document is an electronic communication from the FBI requesting assistance from the Document Conversion Laboratory for scanning and automation of telephone records related to an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez, who was the former house manager for Jeffrey Epstein. The document outlines the procedures for handling and processing these records in support of ongoing investigations.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Alfredo Rodriguez is identified as the former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein, who is under investigation for child prostitution. He is involved in an obstruction of justice case for attempting to sell an address book containing names of potential underage victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is mentioned as the subject of a child prostitution case, with Rodriguez having possession of an address book linked to him.

connections.description: Rodriguez was employed as the house manager and butler for Epstein.

events.title: Obstruction of Justice Case Opened
events.description: The Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez attempted to sell an address book containing names and phone numbers of potential underage victims of Jeffrey Epstein.
Rodriguez was the former house manager and butler to Epstein.
The obstruction of justice case against Rodriguez was opened in October 2009.
The document outlines procedures for scanning and processing telephone records related to the case.
Rodriguez's actions were in response to federal subpoenas issued during pending civil litigation.
